poem:
### The Council's Dance

In the dim halls of power,  
where echoes are spun,  
the Tory councils stir,  
like leaves in an unseen gale.  
Voices whisper delay,  
as if time were an ally,  
seeking a pause  
in the ever-turning wheel—  
An attempt to reshape  
by stepping aside,  
watching democracy's  
shadow lengthen.
